a3

Class Portfolio

  • java.lang.Object
    • a3.Portfolio

  • public class Portfolio
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a portfolio which stores a list of investments.

    • Method Detail

      • buy

        public java.lang.String buy(java.lang.String type,
                            java.lang.String symbol,
                            java.lang.String name,
                            java.lang.String price,
                            java.lang.String quantity)
                     throws LessThanZeroException,
                            EmptyFieldException
        Method to buy more stock or mutual funds
        Parameters:
        type - The type of investment being purchased (Stock or Mutual Fund)
        symbol - The symbol of the investment being purchased
        name - The name of the investment being purchased
        price - The price per share of the investment being purchased
        quantity - The number of shares being purchased
        Returns:
        Returns string representing the purchase order
        Throws:
        LessThanZeroException - When quantity or price is less than zero, the variable is specified in the error message
        EmptyFieldException - When type, symbol, or name is empty, field is specified in the error message

      • sell

        public java.lang.String sell(java.lang.String symbol,
                             java.lang.String price,
                             java.lang.String quantity)
                      throws SymbolNotFoundException,
                             EmptyFieldException,
                             InvalidQuantityException,
                             EmptyListException
        Method to sell stocks or mutual funds
        Parameters:
        symbol - The symbol of the investment being sold
        price - The price of the investment being sold
        quantity - The number of shares being sold
        Returns:
        Returns the sale order as a string
        Throws:
        SymbolNotFoundException - Exception thrown when no investment has a matching symbol
        EmptyFieldException - Exception thrown when one of the fields is empty
        InvalidQuantityException - Exception thrown when the quantity is to big or to small
        EmptyListException - Exception thrown when the list of investments is empty

      • searchControl

        public java.lang.String searchControl(java.lang.String symbol,
                                      java.lang.String keywords,
                                      java.lang.String priceLow,
                                      java.lang.String priceHigh)
                               throws LessThanZeroException,
                                      SymbolNotFoundException,
                                      SearchEmptyException,
                                      EmptyListException
        Method that controls the searching of stocks and mutual funds
        Parameters:
        symbol - The symbol being searched for
        keywords - The keywords being searched for
        priceLow - The lower bound on the price
        priceHigh - The upper bound on the price
        Returns:
        Returns string with formated results of the search
        Throws:
        LessThanZeroException - Exception thrown when a price is less than zero
        SymbolNotFoundException - Exception thrown when the symbol is not found in the search
        SearchEmptyException - Exception thrown when the search returns no results
        EmptyListException - Exception thrown when the list of investments is empty

      • displayInvestment

        public java.lang.String displayInvestment(int index)
        Method used to get the symbol and name of an investment
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the information being looked for
        Returns:
        Returns string with name and symbol of investment delimited by ",,"

      • update

        public java.lang.String update(int currentIndex,
                               java.lang.String price)
        Update the price of every stock and mutual fund
        Parameters:
        currentIndex - The index of the investment being updated
        price - The new price for the investment
        Returns:
        String with the information of the updated investment

      • getTotalGain

        public java.lang.String[] getTotalGain()
                                throws EmptyListException
        Get the total gain on everything user owns based on current prices
        Returns:
        Return the net gain as double
        Throws:
        EmptyListException - Exception thrown when the list is empty
